messages.message: who owns the Doc Translation app on the aihub internal sandbox?  I wanted to incorporate this as part of an existing workflow for a customer demo tomorrow
@jayasooryan and I. Would be great to learn more about the scenario and how we can help

lol sorry just realized is 10 pm local for you - can you give me access to the flow & udfs you wrote for this app so I can add the code to my environment?

use case is processing a combination of english, russian & chinese  docs & then translating the russian / chinese docs to english with the formatting intact

Sorry, I'm in back to backs until quite late today. @jayasooryan or @Aayush should be able to give you access to these details, they did the dev on this. He may not be online tonight though. cc: @Hari

@Hari @jayasooryan @Aayush can you please give me access to the Doc Translation app flow / udfs so that I can add this to an existing flow I built?  I want to use this functionality as the last step in a workflow to translate docs w/ formatting intact

The code for the app exists here: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/tree/master/experimental/jayasooryan/doc-translation.

But I think it will be easier for you to use the ibsolution directly. Use the latest version from here: https://aihub-sandbox.internal.instabase.com/jayasooryan/doc-translation/fs/Instabase%20Drive/

Pick latest version from the `versions` folder and a readme is there on how to run it.

Maybe you can run the ibsolution using IB API's in a UDF step of your flow?
I want to modify it to auto detect the text language & only output in English. I built something like this a year ago but it didnâ€™t leave the doc form / formatting intact

The current doc translation solution doesn't auto-detect the source language. It expects the source language to be passed in as a runtime config.

But you can still implement that logic of language detection in your own UDF and once you have figured out the language, just pass that into the ibsolution. Make sure to map the detected language to the language codes expected by the ibsolution. The list of language codes are there in the readme. :slightly_smiling_face:
